metadata.Title: CVE-2021-33037 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description: Apache Tomcat 10.0.0-M1 to 10.0.6, 9.0.0.M1 to 9.0.46 and 8.5.0 to 8.5.66did not correctly parse the HTTP transfer-encoding request header in somecircumstances leading to the possibility to request smuggling when usedwith a reverse proxy. Specifically: - Tomcat incorrectly ignored thetransfer encoding header if the client declared it would only accept anHTTP/1.0 response; - Tomcat honoured the identify encoding; and - Tomcatdid not ensure that, if present, the chunked encoding was the finalencoding.

criterions.comment: tomcat6 package in esm-apps/xenial is affected and may need fixing.
tomcat7 package in esm-apps/xenial is affected and may need fixing.
tomcat8: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
